attributes.action: National referendum on whether the U.k. should end the policy of Net Zero
attributes.additional_details: The imposition of wide ranging Net Zero policies is of huge significance for the people in the UK. The pursuance and impact of Net Zero policies has not been debated and voted upon in isolation of party politics and propoganda. A clear mandate from the people based on a fair balanced debate between experienced, qualified and knowledgeable people is required to gain a common assent for or against the policies of Net Zero. The issue of Net Zero is muddied by party politics. A mandate is needed.
attributes.background: Allow a referendum to decide if UK should continue to decarbonise the UK economy. To frame clear debate between scientists over the efficacy of Net Zero policy and debate between business and financial people and economists about the impact on living standards in UK

rejection.details:
There’s already a petition about this issue. We cannot accept a new petition when we already have one about a very similar issue.

You are more likely to get action on this issue if you sign and share a single petition.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/701342
